meanings.definition: A person who steals goods during a time of disorder or unrest.
meanings.sent1: The looters took advantage of the chaos to steal from the store.
meanings.sent2: The police arrested the looters who were stealing from the damaged buildings.
meanings.sent3: The looters were so sneaky, they even stole the mayor's hat!
meanings.sent4: The looters were like hungry wolves, scavenging for anything they could find.
meanings.sent5: The image of the looters running with stolen goods is etched in my mind.

meanings.definition: To steal goods during a time of disorder or unrest.
meanings.sent1: During the riot, some people looters goods from the shops.
meanings.sent2: The thieves looters electronics from the store before fleeing.
meanings.sent3: The raccoon looters some snacks from the picnic basket when no one was looking.
meanings.sent4: She looters the spotlight with her amazing dance moves.
meanings.sent5: The pirate looters treasure from the sunken ship with great skill.
